description: First appearance of string n in e.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, e Digits
mathematica: (* Computing 200000 digits of e is sufficient up to n=10000 *) eString = RealDigits[E, 10, 200000] // First // ToString /@ # & // StringJoin; a[n_] := (p = StringPosition[eString, n // ToString, 1]; If[p == {}, 0, p[[1, 1]]]); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 60}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 04 2013 *)With[{eee=RealDigits[E,10,200000][[1]]},Transpose[Flatten[Table[ SequencePosition[ eee,IntegerDigits[n],1],{n,70}],1]][[1]]] (* The program uses the SequencePosition function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 20 2015 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A088576 (same as a(n) but including the term for n = 0).
author: _Harvey P. Dale_
